body_html:
Can you isolate the difference to a specific op? (Ie it's not clear if this is caused by a bug, or by difference in op semantics which is not a bug)
…
On Feb 18, 2017 10:20 PM, "Tianjian Jiang" ***@***.***> wrote: The code can be viewed at https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs. The tensorflow code's generated result of conditional VAE is in Tensorflow-VAEs//misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist/ <https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs/tree/master/misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist> While the PyTorch's is in Tensorflow-VAEs/PyTorch/CVAE.py/ <https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs/tree/master/PyTorch/CVAE.py> It seems that the label can hardly influence the generated images, while in PyTorch, the code just runs smoothly. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#7624 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AABaHJck6v85VR7cJUJLhc78U_uIfEipks5rd98qgaJpZM4MEWSb> .
body_text:
Can you isolate the difference to a specific op? (Ie it's not clear if this
is caused by a bug, or by difference in op semantics which is not a bug)
…
On Feb 18, 2017 10:20 PM, "Tianjian Jiang" ***@***.***> wrote:
 The code can be viewed at https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs.

 The tensorflow code's generated result of conditional VAE is in
 Tensorflow-VAEs//misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist/
 <https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs/tree/master/misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist>

 While the PyTorch's is in Tensorflow-VAEs/PyTorch/CVAE.py/
 <https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs/tree/master/PyTorch/CVAE.py>

 It seems that the label can hardly influence the generated images, while
 in PyTorch, the code just runs smoothly.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#7624 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AABaHJck6v85VR7cJUJLhc78U_uIfEipks5rd98qgaJpZM4MEWSb>
 .
body:
Can you isolate the difference to a specific op? (Ie it's not clear if this
is caused by a bug, or by difference in op semantics which is not a bug)

On Feb 18, 2017 10:20 PM, "Tianjian Jiang" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> The code can be viewed at https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs.
>
> The tensorflow code's generated result of conditional VAE is in
> Tensorflow-VAEs//misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist/
> <https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs/tree/master/misc/condition_generated_imgs/cvae-mlp-mnist>
>
> While the PyTorch's is in Tensorflow-VAEs/PyTorch/CVAE.py/
> <https://github.com/Response777/Tensorflow-VAEs/tree/master/PyTorch/CVAE.py>
>
> It seems that the label can hardly influence the generated images, while
> in PyTorch, the code just runs smoothly.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/7624#issuecomment-280899166>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AABaHJck6v85VR7cJUJLhc78U_uIfEipks5rd98qgaJpZM4MEWSb>
> .
